content:
Add a Field to a FlexCard

Display data fields returned from a data source on a FlexCard.

From the FlexCards tab, click a version of a FlexCard to open the FlexCard Designer.
To add a data field, perform one of these tasks:

Click Fields to view the list of available data fields, and drag a data field into a state on the canvas.

Drag the Field element from the Elements list into a state on the canvas.

(Optional) From the Properties panel, update the element name in the Element Name field.
(Optional) Enter a visible label in the Label field.

Beginning with Summer '21, Label supports concatenated strings. Combine plain text and supported merge fields.

(Optional) Add placeholder text in the Placeholder field.
(Optional) To set a data type, select one from the Field Type dropdown.

If you select Date as a Field Type, make sure that the date value matches the user locale format.

To configure additional properties for your selected Field Type, see FlexCards Field Properties.

If you dragged the Field element from the Build panel, in the Output field, click into the field and select from the available data fields returned from the data source.

Beginning with Summer '21, Output supports concatenated strings.

(Optional) When Date is selected for Field Type, enable Use Absolute Date to prevent converting the date based on the timezone when Format is updated.

Don't enable if Date is the Field Type and your field element returns a date as a string that doesnâ€™t match the defined format.

(Optional) Beginning Winter '22, enter descriptive text in Help Text.
(Optional) If your FlexCard is used across different locales, enable Use User Locale For Formatting to use the logged-in user's locale to determine the format of your date, time, and currency.
title: Adding Fields to FlexCards in OmniStudio
